title: Upper-Intermediate English 406
headline: This free online English course discusses movies and how to use the future perfect and future perfect continuous tense.
description: This English course provides the vocabulary for discussing the cinema or going to the movies. Study the future perfect and future perfect continuous tenses while comparing them to the future simple tense. Explore how to use 'will' and 'going to' to describe plans and predictions in noun clauses. We demonstrate how 'going to' and 'would' are used to discuss plans that have since changed or been abandoned. Sign up to polish your English skills.
courseDescription:
Watching movies at home or in the cinema is a popular leisure activity, and fans love discussing their favorite films, how they were made, and who starred in them. We have therefore designed this course to teach you basic vocabulary related to movies and filmmaking. This English course helps you master the language used to converse about your favorite movies, characters, and actors.

We cover two grammar topics. First, we review the future perfect tense and compare it to the future simple tense to help you understand when it is more appropriate to use each. We introduce you to the future perfect continuous tense and demonstrate how to use it to form statements and questions. The second grammar topic covers discussions about plans, intentions, and predictions. We show you how to use 'will' and 'going to' when discussing the future. The course also covers their use as part of noun clauses. We examine 'would' in noun clauses to discuss once-laid plans that have since changed or did not happen.

You will then integrate your new grammar and vocabulary skills by practicing reading, listening, and writing using what you have learned about the movies, filmmaking, the future perfect, the future perfect continuous, and 'will' and 'going to.' Continue to progress as an English student by ensuring that you take the time to practice. To help you further your skills, we have included some writing tips and exercises in our 'Resources' section. Sign up today and gain confidence when discussing movies with your friends.
